This post is another walk-through of a shiny application using the  [`leprechaun` framework](https://leprechaun.opifex.org/#/). `leprechaun` apps are lightweight [`golem` apps](https://golemverse.org/), "*this means applications are leaner, and smaller; hence the name 'leprechaun.'*"--I'll go through developing a `leprechaun` shiny app-package (and how it's different from `golem` and regular (`devtools`) app-packages).


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-fold="false"}
install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("devOpifex/leprechaun")
```
:::


For consistency, I'll be using the application from the RStudio's [Building Web Applications with Shiny](https://rstudio-education.github.io/shiny-course/) course. These materials are a great resource if you're new to shiny--even if you're aren't, it's still worth checking out--plus it's free!
